meanings.definition: (noun) a superhuman being or spirit worshipped as having power over nature or human fortunes
meanings.sent1: The ancient Greeks believed in many gods who controlled different aspects of life.
meanings.sent2: People in various cultures pray to gods for guidance and protection.
meanings.sent3: When the little girl lost her favorite toy, she jokingly prayed to the gods to help her find it.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged on as if the gods themselves were angry at the world below.
meanings.sent5: The gods of ancient mythology were often depicted with incredible strength and wisdom.

meanings.definition: (verb) to treat or regard with reverence and devotion
meanings.sent1: The villagers would gods the sacred tree by offering fruits and flowers.
meanings.sent2: She gods her grandmother for all the wisdom and love she shared.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to gods their teacher by organizing a surprise party for her birthday.
meanings.sent4: In many cultures, people gods their ancestors by honoring their traditions and stories.
meanings.sent5: He would always gods the old book that had been passed down through generations in his family.
